items.doc: 47 Civil Code of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: In a technology transfer contract, where the transferee implements the patented technology as agreed but infringes upon the lawful rights and interests of a third party, how should liability be borne according to the relevant provisions of the Civil Code?
items.options: A. The transferee shall bear the liability for infringement independently; B. The transferor shall bear the liability for infringement, unless otherwise agreed by the parties; C. The transferor and transferee shall bear joint and several liability; D. The technology provider shall bear liability for breach of contract rather than infringement liability
items.user_answer: C. The transferor and transferee shall bear joint and several liability

items.doc: 115 Interim Measures for Seven-Day Unconditional Returns of Goods Purchased Online (2020 Revised Edition).txt
items.question: According to the relevant provisions of the Interim Measures for the Seven-Day Unconditional Return of Goods Purchased Online, if an online seller offers unconditional returns for goods that cannot be fully restored to their original condition and fails to clearly label the actual condition of the goods in a conspicuous manner, what penalty shall be imposed where no provisions exist in laws or administrative regulations?
items.options: A. Impose a direct fine of thirty thousand yuan; B. Issue a warning, order rectification, and impose a fine of not less than ten thousand yuan but not more than thirty thousand yuan; C. Issue a warning only, without imposing a fine; D. Order suspension of business operations for rectification and impose a fine not exceeding RMB 50,000
items.user_answer: B. Issue a warning, order rectification, and impose a fine of not less than ten thousand yuan but not more than thirty thousand yuan

items.doc: 119-Regulations on the Supervision and Administration of Securities Companies.txt
items.question: According to China's securities supervision regulations, which of the following options correctly describes the conditions for exempting a securities company's compliance officer from liability?
items.options: A. The compliance officer may be exempted from liability whenever the securities company commits any illegal or non-compliant acts; B. The compliance officer may be exempted from liability if they have lawfully fulfilled their duties to prevent and report such acts; C. The compliance officer may be exempted from liability by merely reporting internally to the company; D. The compliance officer must successfully prevent the illegal or non-compliant conduct to be exempted from liability.
items.user_answer: D. The compliance officer must successfully prevent the illegal or non-compliant conduct to be exempted from liability.

items.doc: 186 Good Manufacturing Practice for Pharmaceutical Products.txt
items.question: According to the provisions on material management in the Good Manufacturing Practice for Pharmaceutical Products, which of the following statements regarding the use of raw and auxiliary materials is correct?
items.options: A. Raw and auxiliary materials may be used immediately provided their packaging is intact, even without approval from the quality management department; B. Raw and auxiliary materials must satisfy both conditions: approval for release by the quality management department and being within their expiry date or re-inspection period; C. Raw and auxiliary materials may be used provided they are within their expiry date, without requiring specific approval from the quality management department; D. Raw and auxiliary materials may be used directly after passing inspection, without requiring release approval from the quality management department.
items.user_answer: B. Raw and auxiliary materials must satisfy both conditions: approval for release by the quality management department and being within their expiry date or re-inspection period

items.doc: 62 Law of the People's Republic of China on the Promotion of Private Education.txt
items.question: According to the relevant provisions of China's Private Education Promotion Law, which of the following options reflects special support for non-profit private schools among the government's support measures for private schools?
items.options: A. The People's Government allocates corresponding educational funding when entrusting private schools with compulsory education responsibilities; B. Support measures such as government subsidies and fund rewards for non-profit private schools; C. Private schools may accept donations from citizens, legal persons or other organisations in accordance with laws and regulations; D. The State encourages financial institutions to employ credit instruments to support the development of private education.
items.user_answer: C. Private schools may accept donations from citizens, legal persons or other organisations in accordance with laws and regulations

items.question: According to China's direct selling management regulations, which of the following options correctly describes the legal restrictions on recruiting direct sellers?
items.options: A. Direct selling enterprises may recruit full-time students as direct sellers, subject to consent from their guardians; B. Direct selling enterprises may recruit active-duty military personnel as direct sellers, subject to approval from their respective units; C. Direct selling enterprises shall not recruit persons lacking full capacity for civil conduct as direct sellers; D. Direct selling enterprises may recruit overseas personnel as direct sellers, but must obtain relevant work permits.
items.user_answer: D. Direct selling enterprises may recruit overseas personnel as direct sellers, but must obtain relevant work permits.

items.doc: 207 Regulations on the Administration of Foreign-Invested Venture Capital Enterprises.txt
items.question: According to the relevant regulations on foreign-invested venture capital enterprises, which of the following options correctly addresses the handling of shareholder status after a domestic enterprise receives venture capital investment?
items.options: A. Following venture capital investment, existing domestic natural person shareholders of an established domestic enterprise must withdraw; B. Following venture capital investment, existing domestic natural person shareholders of an established domestic enterprise may retain their shareholder status after the enterprise is converted into a foreign-invested enterprise; C. Following venture capital investment, domestic enterprises must be wholly converted into enterprises held by overseas investors; D. Following venture capital investment, the original shareholder status of a domestic enterprise shall automatically lapse, requiring reapplication.
items.user_answer: B. Following venture capital investment, existing domestic natural person shareholders of an established domestic enterprise may retain their shareholder status after the enterprise is converted into a foreign-invested enterprise

items.doc: 04-Criminal Law of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: According to the provisions of China's Criminal Law concerning identity crimes, which of the following acts constitutes an independent identity crime?
items.options: A. Using a forged driving licence in activities where identity verification is required; B. Stealing another person's identity to obtain civil service recruitment qualifications on their behalf; C. Illegally producing standard-issue People's Police uniforms; D. Illegally acquiring state secrets through purchase
items.user_answer: B. Stealing another person's identity to obtain civil service recruitment qualifications on their behalf

items.doc: 05-Criminal Procedure Law of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: According to the fundamental principles of the Criminal Procedure Law of the People's Republic of China, which of the following options correctly describes the allocation and exercise of powers by specialised organs in criminal proceedings?
items.options: A. When handling cases involving endangering national security, the scope of authority of the national security organs is identical to that of the public security organs; B. The people's courts, people's procuratorates and public security organs shall, in criminal proceedings, be responsible for their respective duties, cooperate with each other and exercise mutual restraint; C. Administrative organs may, under specific circumstances, be authorised to exercise criminal investigation powers; D. Social organisations have the right to propose binding opinions on specific cases during the supervision of criminal proceedings.
items.user_answer: A. When handling cases involving endangering national security, the scope of authority of the national security organs is identical to that of the public security organs

items.doc: 06-Administrative Licensing Law of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: According to the Administrative Licensing Law's provisions on administrative licensing timeframes, which of the following correctly describes the general timeframe for administrative organs to make administrative licensing decisions?
items.options: A. The administrative authority shall make a decision within thirty days from the date of acceptance of the administrative licence application; B. The administrative authority shall make a decision within twenty days from the date of acceptance of the administrative licence application, which may be extended by five days with the approval of the head of the authority; C. The administrative authority shall make a decision within twenty days from the date of acceptance of the administrative licence application, which may be extended by ten days with the approval of the head of the authority; D. The administrative authority shall make a decision within fifteen days from the date of accepting the administrative licence application, and may extend the period by seven days with the approval of the head of the authority.
items.user_answer: B. The administrative authority shall make a decision within twenty days from the date of acceptance of the administrative licence application, which may be extended by five days with the approval of the head of the authority
